intro: Syntherisma sanguinalis subsp. ciliaris, commonly known as the scarlet sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit, with slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry environments. Syntherisma sanguinalis subsp. ciliaris is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, including disturbed areas and along roadsides.
